text.test3c3: \af[1]\n<\N[1]><WordWrap>One second wait is bad  \| but not too bad.  chaanged

01douglass.eigthVictory: \af[1]\n<\N[1]><WordWrap>Crystals are nice I guess, but no gold?

02maid.day02: \af[2]\n<\N[2]><WordWrap>I don't even have sick days yet!  Can you even take disaster days?
02maid.secondFloor: \af[2]\n<\N[2]><WordWrap>These bugs are s-so much bigger in person.

03guard.filler: I'm no hero, but maybe I can do something...
03guard.day02: \af[3]\n<\N[3]><WordWrap>Don't worry Ma'm, we'll take care of things.
03guard.day03: \af[3]\n<\N[3]><WordWrap>Maybe if we stand closer to the entrance? - No... Sara was quite far off.
03guard.secondFloor: \af[3]\n<\N[3]><WordWrap>These bugs are s-so much bigger in person.

04cultist.filler: the cave will devour you all
04cultist.day02: \af[4]\n<\N[4]><WordWrap>Don't worry.  I'm sure you'll serve in the new world as well.
04cultist.day03: \af[4]\n<\N[4]><WordWrap>You're watching the animals right?  Could I borrow a goat?
04cultist.day04c1: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>You should have paid more attention in history.  I don't think your runes mean what you think.

05miller.filler: The winter is usually when I get to relax, but now?
05miller.day02: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>I drew the short straw, why are you still here?
05miller.day03: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>You killed a wolf when you were twelve, you got this.
05miller.day04: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>I'm not looking forward to sorting the animals back out when people come back.
05miller.day05: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>Maybe we can spare a few steaks to get spirits up a bit.

06blacksmith.filler: Not open for business I'm afraid.  Been working overtime on tools for the cave.
06blacksmith.day02: \af[6]\n<\N[6]><WordWrap>I'm afraid I haven't any goods for the mayor today.
06blacksmith.day03: \af[6]\n<\N[6]><WordWrap>I'm afraid I don't have time to fix bits and bridles at the moment.
06blacksmith.day04: \af[6]\n<\N[6]><WordWrap>I'm afraid I'm a bit behind on my regular tasks.  What with all these armor and weapon jobs.
06blacksmith.day05: \af[6]\n<\N[6]><WordWrap>I'm afraid that fence isn't going to fix itself.  I can spare some nails though. (divergence point?)
06blacksmith.day06: \af[6]\n<\N[6]><WordWrap>I'm afraid I haven't seen Sir Meister's sword lately

07priest.filler: I cannot stand by while souls are in danger, but I do not know what I can do.
07priest.day02: \af[7]\n<\N[7]><WordWrap>I see we both do what we can to provide comfort in these troubled times.
07priest.day03: \af[7]\n<\N[7]><WordWrap>It is good to see you again Mrs Miller.
07priest.day04c1: \af[7]\n<\N[7]><WordWrap>Is there anything I can do for you?
07priest.day04c2: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>Not unless you're handy with a hammer.
07priest.day05: \af[7]\n<\N[7]><WordWrap>I wonder if the beasts of the field are better off for not knowing fear as we do.
07priest.day07c2: \af[7]\n<\N[7]><WordWrap>Do you worry for his future or his past?

08bartender.day02: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>It may be cynical, but the impending doom has been great for business.
08bartender.day03: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>My mother always said despair is the best seasoning... which is why I left home at such a young age.
08bartender.day04: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>I'm gald to see you're taking a break.  It can't be healthy working like you do all day.
08bartender.day05: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>I swear, if that junk peddler asks for another discount...
08bartender.day06: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>You even old enough to drink hon? -of course I am!  We might have to change the game's rating otherwise.
08bartender.day07: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>Sometimes I wonder if that knight of yours is sneaking a drink now and then...
08bartender.day08: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>Hey kid.  You really look up to that old man don'tcha?

10squire.day02: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>Don't worry, I'm sure Sir Meister will save us,\. eventually.
10squire.day03: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>Thank you for looking after Sir Meister's steed.  He will need it.\.  Eventually.
10squire.day04c1: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>Perhaps I could be of service?  I am trained to look after horses.
10squire.day04c2: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>Though I am sure Sir meister will call for me.\.  Eventually.
10squire.day05: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>His biggest regret is that he never slew a dragon.
10squire.day06: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>Why did he have to hear about this curse?
10squire.day10c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>Oh hey!  I've been meaning to talk to you!  What is sir Meister really like?
10squire.day10c2: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>It sounds like I'm not really the one you want to talk to.

11looter.day02: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>Hey, don't you have plates to polish or something?
11looter.day03: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>Windows sure are getting dirty without someone to clean them huh?
11looter.day04: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>Hey, I hear your fence broke.  Here, take these boards I...found.  Just don't tell anyone where you got them.
11looter.day05: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>Hey, I ain't bugging your animals am I?  So don't bug me.
11looter.day06: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>I don't like the way you keep looking at me.  Buzz off.
11looter.day07c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>What do you think of the current crisis?
11looter.day07c2: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>Would you people just leave me alone!
11looter.day08: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>Why would I take a sword?  Especially one with some guy's crest on it.  That just hurts resale value.
11looter.day09: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>I haven't seen your boss lately, because I hear him first.  That parade armor is ridiculous.
11looter.day10: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>You know, guy your height could get into a lot of palces...
11looter.day11: \af[11]\n<\N[11]><WordWrap>Yeah, get on out there and make evil fear to tread, lady.

12adventuress.filler: That brother of mine, fussing over vegetables while the world comes to an end.  He shaves his head you know, he's not even that old.
12adventuress.day02: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>Isn't it exciting having all these warriors in town?
12adventuress.day03: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>Need help seeing to the horses? - Not after last time I don't.
12adventuress.day04c1: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>Do you think more adventurers are going to arrive?
12adventuress.day04c2: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>If Patric got the word out, mabye.
12adventuress.day05: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>I hear Ms Smythe is starting a boot camp?!
12adventuress.day06c1: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>So, Sir Meister isnt... What I expected.
12adventuress.day06c2: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>We can hardly blam him for that now can we?
12adventuress.day07: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>Where'd you learn to fight?  You're pretty good for a squire.
12adventuress.day10: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>Why do you make excuses for that old man?
12adventuress.day11: \af[12]\n<\N[12]><WordWrap>S-so what if the others failed?  I've got more heart than all of them together!

13drunk.filler: I'm sure -hic- somebody'll figure it out.
13drunk.day03: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>Wonder if this is how cows think, when one'a them disappears.
13drunk.day04: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>Oh no... \.-hic-\. the sheep giving you trouble?
13drunk.day05: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>Dun worry boss \.-hic-\. doin' what I always do.
13drunk.day06: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>I may be a loser \.-hic-\. but at least I'll admit it.
13drunk.day09: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>So, someday you'll be a big hero too huh?  \.-hic- \.ain't what it's cracked up to be.
13drunk.day10c1: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>Nobody knew what they were doing alright?  It's not like I wanted thing t' end up like... with all of them...
13drunk.day10c2:
\af[22]\n<\N[22]>I can't hear you very well.
\| Take a step closer.
13drunk.day11c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>That's it?  You've just been here since?
13drunk.day11c2: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>What else is there to say?  Some came back from the war better, some didn't.
13drunk.day12: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>Ya learned the fifty bajillion spider toenail technique yet? \. -hic-
13drunk.day13: \af[13]\n<\N[13]><WordWrap>Yeah, make sure to run the town real good like.  Maybe then it'll look pretty when some kids in uniform burn it down.

14son.filler: I'm not going to run away.
14son.day02: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>If my father is staying, I'm staying!
14son.day04: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>Thank you for doing your part to keep everyone strong.
14son.day05: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>Sorry we, I mean, my dad's been taking Todd's dea- disappearance a little hard.  Please give us some time.
14son.day06c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>So, you know mayorship isn't heritable right?
14son.day06c2: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>Okay, I'm pretty sure you're making fun of me now.
14son.day07: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>I can do this!  I know it!
14son.day08: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>It can be hard to measure up to those we admire.
14son.day09: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>(training ground) Okay, my timing is still a little off..
14son.day13: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>Things aren't that bad. ,, Guess anyone that wanted to complain already left.
14son.day14: \af[14]\n<\N[14]><WordWrap>I don't know what to do for them.  Looks like I need to work on my people skills.

15merchant.filler: somebody's got to eat this food before it goes bad.
15merchant.day02: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>Well somebody's got to eat this food before it goes bad!
15merchant.day03c1: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>The stuff they've found down there is pretty good so far, but it gets better the deeper you go!
15merchant.day03c2: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>Just imagine what must be waiting at the bottom!
15merchant.day04: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>So, I suppose I have you to thank for this meat?  It's quite good.
15merchant.day05c1: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>You're really going to fight for us?
15merchant.day05c2: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>Just playing the odds.  When someone else fixes things I'll be first in line to get the treasure to market!
15merchant.day05c3: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>At least you have confidence in us...
15merchant.day06: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>Once I've made it big maybe I'll hire you to carry my stuff.
15merchant.day07: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>I am really getting sick of those two.
15merchant.day08: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>Yep... so glad to know these guys are protecting the town.
15merchant.day09c1: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>Bout time the axeman got off his rear.
15merchant.day10: \af[15]\n<\N[15]><WordWrap>Hold on, hold on.  I just need a little break.
15merchant.day15c1:
\af[15]\n<\N[15]>Oh you smile now.
But tomorrow I'm going to teach you how to write a shipping manafest.

16sage.day02: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>There isn't much to see right now.  Without someone to follow I can't see beyond the entrance.
16sage.day03: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>The spell is difficult to maintain, but I will endure.
16sage.day04: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>I almost saw something at the end that time...
16sage.day05: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>The curse strikes with no regard for persons...
16sage.day06: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>If I disappear who will maintain the view?
16sage.day07: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>It is not enough to believe in magic, one must have focus as well.
16sage.day08: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>I don't think you're approaching from the right way...
16sage.day09: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>Perhaps you could ask her to help?
16sage.day10: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>Sigh... I don't suppose you've had any spark of seership? Strange dreams maybe?
16sage.day11: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>It's close, but too unfocused to do us any good...
16sage.day12: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>So, when you look into the glass, what do you see?
16sage.day13c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>You have to admit, this would be a great way to do investigative reporting.
16sage.day13c2: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>In other times your lack of far-sight might be a relief.
16sage.day14: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>Now is not the time for personal matters.  We must work to help the entire town.
16sage.day16: \af[16]\n<\N[16]><WordWrap>This is... useful, but not so much right now.

17woodcutter.filler: When my time comes I'll be ready.
17woodcutter.day03c1: \af[5]\n<\N[5]><WordWrap>Hey, could I get some wood to fix a fence?
17woodcutter.day03c3: \af[8]\n<\N[8]><WordWrap>I wouldn't be letting him near an axe honey.  Trust me on this one.
17woodcutter.day04: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>You know, it was pretty hard to accept that my son died.  But I did it.  And now?  Now that wound is open again.
17woodcutter.day05c1: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>I've waited years to find some closure, what's another couple of days?
17woodcutter.day06: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>Dun worry, I'll be sober if it's my turn in the morning.
17woodcutter.day07: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>Wha'd you do to get that bozo so angry anyway?
17woodcutter.day08c1: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>I jus' want one of those monsters to wander out of the cave
17woodcutter.day08c2: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>So's I can give it a few whacks.
17woodcutter.day09: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>Okay, you know what?  It's time to get serious.  Lets do this!
17woodcutter.day10: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>Come on moneybags!  Show that dummy who's boss!
17woodcutter.day11: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>You think you're scary?  I ain't no crow!
17woodcutter.day14: \af[17]\n<\N[17]><WordWrap>But there must be a way to see him...

18teacher.day02: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>We had to send the children away- at least now I don't need to hide my drinking.
18teacher.day03: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>Why am I here?...\|  Shoot, why am I here?
18teacher.day04c1: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>You should have paid more attention in history.  I don't think your runes mean what you think.
18teacher.day05: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>How do you think the cave chooses?  It doesn't seem to be the closest people...
18teacher.day08: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>Let me draw a chart of what I'm trying to do...
18teacher.day13: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>Todd was a good kid. But,  I think he felt like he couldn't be as good as you...
18teacher.day15c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>So you're a schoolteacher, what inspired you to take up a sword?
18teacher.day15c2: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>I'd like to say I wanted to make sure there was something for them to come back to.
18teacher.day15c4: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>Really, I think it's just a way out I wouldn't have to be ashamed of.
18teacher.day17c1: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>I am sorry about your son.  He was a good kid.
18teacher.day17c3: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>I mean, he is a good kid.
18teacher.day18: \af[18]\n<\N[18]><WordWrap>I don't know if I'm ready for the end, but I know they aren't.  I can't let them down.

19paladin.day02: \af[19]\n<\N[19]><WordWrap>I would charge into that cave right now, but someone needs to keep an eye on that cultist!
19paladin.day03c1: \af[19]\n<\N[19]><WordWrap>A young lad like that ought to be reading books.
19paladin.day03c3: \af[19]\n<\N[19]><WordWrap>But he should be reading different books!
19paladin.day04: \af[19]\n<\N[19]><WordWrap>Don't worry ma'm.  I'll be keeping an eye on this one.
19paladin.day05c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>What would you say is your biggest regret?
19paladin.day12: \af[19]\n<\N[19]><WordWrap>A spin move is just a fancy way of turning your back on a foe!
19paladin.day13: \af[19]\n<\N[19]><WordWrap>I'm glad they're learning well.  I'd demonstrate the technique myself, but if I don't take care of my spine who will?
19paladin.day18c1: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>They miss you down at the training feild.
19paladin.day18c2: \af[19]\n<\N[19]><WordWrap>Oh yes, just give me a bit to rest and I'll slay a scarecrow.
19paladin.day19c1: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>I had another question about the footwork you used in our spar the other day.

21butler.filler: Dinner is not quite ready yet, please be patient.
21butler.day02: \af[21]\n<\N[21]><WordWrap>The dishes aren't quite ready yet.  We have only just served dinner.
21butler.day03: \af[21]\n<\N[21]><WordWrap>Cooking for this many people.  It almost reminds me of home.
21butler.day04: \af[21]\n<\N[21]><WordWrap>It's good to have something to do.  Keeps the mind occupied.
21butler.day05: \af[21]\n<\N[21]><WordWrap>My sister says I grew up too fast.  I say she is too childish.  You'd hardly guess we were twins.
21butler.day06: \af[21]\n<\N[21]><WordWrap>An old butler commands more respect than a young one.
21butler.day18: \af[21]\n<\N[21]><WordWrap>It's good to see you.  This afternoon I'll whip up something that will put that bar food to shame.

22prisoner.day03c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>So, how did you end up here?
22prisoner.day04: \af[22]\n<\N[22]><WordWrap>At least the food ain't so bad.
22prisoner.day05: \af[22]\n<\N[22]><WordWrap>Why am I still here with the curse going on?  Two words, recidivism.
22prisoner.day13: \af[22]\n<\N[22]><WordWrap>Hey, I'm ready to come out now.  Not looking ta throttle anyone else.
22prisoner.day14c1: \af[22]\n<\N[22]><WordWrap>So kid, looking to be a leader?  Best make sure you do a good job.
22prisoner.day14c2: \af[22]\n<\N[22]><WordWrap>Or someone like me will come looking for you.
22prisoner.day15: \af[22]\n<\N[22]><WordWrap>I mean, I'm stuck in it now right?  Everybody else that left spread some kind of plague.
22prisoner.day16: \af[22]\n<\N[22]><WordWrap>So what's your deal?  I know a good scowl when I see one.

23doctor.day02: \af[23]\n<\N[23]><WordWrap>I'm trying to prep for the injuries Douglass will have when he comes back.  Did you see what that last gooey thing did?  I kinda closed my eyes...
23doctor.day03: \af[23]\n<\N[23]><WordWrap>Don't get me wrong, as a doctor I have to deal with all kinds of, um... goo, but those slimes give me the willies.
23doctor.day04: \af[23]\n<\N[23]><WordWrap>Maybe I can still help.  Every living thing has to have some weakness after all. - But does a slime even have a hamstring?
23doctor.day05c1: \af[23]\n<\N[23]><WordWrap>So slimes seem to be phlegmatic.  Which may mean they may be susceptable to cold.
23doctor.day06: \af[23]\n<\N[23]><WordWrap>The thing that bothers me is that the slimey things don't seem to have more than one skeloton worth of bones in them...
23doctor.day07c1: \af[23]\n<\N[23]><WordWrap>I'm not sure what to do about the big bugs.  I've never needed to find a weakness in something that small.
23doctor.day07c2: \af[10]\n<\N[10]><WordWrap>They have a hard shell right?  Against an armored foe it's often best to hit them with something even harder.

24soldier.day02: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>Douglass had spirit alright, but he held his arm a bit stiff when he swung.  I should've called him out on that...
24soldier.day03: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>That poor girl, she had no idea what she was doing...
24soldier.day04c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>What inspired you to stay when you are too old to contribute?
24soldier.day04c2: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>Why you...\|  You know what!  I'm not dried up yet.
24soldier.day04c3: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>There are still things I can do.  Bout time I got to doing them.
24soldier.day05: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>Ah, there you are.  I've conscripted a few of your scarecrows.  Hope you don't mind.
24soldier.day06: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>Don't hunch over it!  It's a sword, not a newborn!
24soldier.day11c2: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>That's nice, but I want to see you practice your single slash "manuver".
24soldier.day15: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>I'll say this about 'moneybags', he's leanging to throw his weight around.
24soldier.day16: \af[24]\n<\N[24]><WordWrap>The old knight must have been quite formitable in his prime.

25midwife.filler: No doctor should have to work alone.
25midwife.day02: \af[25]\n<\N[25]><WordWrap>I know Douglass is alive, I just know it.
25midwife.day19c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>So, um, so you think they are alive?
25midwife.day20c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>Shouldn't you be maintaining the scrying orb?
25midwife.day20c2: \af[25]\n<\N[25]><WordWrap>Nah, I set it up so it runs on its own now.

26mayor.filler: Don't worry, we'll get through this.
26mayor.day02c1: \af[26]\n<\N[26]><WordWrap>I intend to stay here, but I won't hold you to the same.
26mayor.day02c2: \af[2]\n<\N[2]><WordWrap>Oh t-that's fine sir, not looking for any preferential treatment.
26mayor.day05: \af[26]\n<\N[26]><WordWrap>I had hoped...  But now he won't have the chance to change his mind.
26mayor.day08c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>But why didn't you try to do something before the curse happened?
26mayor.day08c2: \af[26]\n<\N[26]><WordWrap>The price of dealing with that cave has always been too high, it's still too high.

27crone.filler: I'd go if these old bones could make the trip.--Lady I still think it's weird that you carry bones in your purse.
27crone.day02: \af[27]\n<\N[27]><WordWrap>Aye, keep your distance or I'll show you a curse of my own!
27crone.day09: \af[27]\n<\N[27]><WordWrap>Oh, so now you're saying I've been using magic to spy on people?
27crone.day12c2: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>Ma'm please, I've interview witches before.  I know what one looks like.

28teamster.day06: \af[28]\n<\N[28]><WordWrap>There were so many sick...  So quickly.
28teamster.day08c1: \af[28]\n<\N[28]><WordWrap>What do you do when everything you've done to help just makes things worse?
28teamster.day08c2: \af[28]\n<\N[28]><WordWrap>Well, Sir Meister used to say that failure teaches us more than success, and that wisdom is more valuable than heroism.
28teamster.day09c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>I just want to know what happened to the people who left with you.

29journalist.filler: So how did you end up in this cell?  (prisoner) I strangled an obnoxious journalist.
29journalist.day02c1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>Oh hey!  So, what is it about the mayor that has inspired you to be so faithful?
29journalist.day02c2: \af[2]\n<\N[2]><WordWrap>Well, I guess it's because he really took a chance hiring me.
29journalist.day07a1: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>What do you think of the current crisis?
29journalist.day07a2: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap> Have you seen that guy who was hanging around here earlier?
29journalist.day18c5: \af[29]\n<\N[29]><WordWrap>Don't take this the wrong way, but it's good to hear you say that.

30elder.getIce: \af[30]\n<\N[30]><WordWrap>I worry that this may be too little too late.
30elder.getAir: \af[30]\n<\N[30]><WordWrap>If I hurry... maybe I can still make it.
